name: E2. PermuTree  hard version
statement:
You are given a tree with n vertices rooted at vertex 1.For some
permutation^
dagger a of length n, let f(a) be the number of pairs of vertices (u, v)
such that a_u < a_{
operatorname{lca}(u, v)} < a_v. Here,
operatorname{lca}(u,v) denotes the lowest common ancestor of vertices u
and v.Find the maximum possible value of f(a) over all permutations a of
length n.^
dagger A permutation of length n is an array consisting of n distinct
integers from 1 to n in arbitrary order. For example, [2,3,1,5,4] is a
permutation, but [1,2,2] is not a permutation (2 appears twice in the
array), and [1,3,4] is also not a permutation (n=3 but there is 4 in the
array).
